contentrichtext.text: '''Kevorkian''' is a common [[Armenian people|Armenian]] family name particularly in [[Western Armenian]]. Variants include Kévorkian and Kervorkian. The [[Eastern Armenian]] equivalent is '''[[Gevorgyan]]''', at times Gevorkyan or Gevorkian. ==Individuals carrying the family name== *[[François Kevorkian]], French-Armenian DJ, remixer, producer and record label owner *[[Hagop Kevorkian]], Turkish-Armenian archeologist, connoisseur and collector of art *[[Jack Kevorkian]], Armenian-American pathologist, right-to-die activist *[[Raymond Kévorkian]] French-Armenian historian *[[Vahram Kevorkian]], Belgian-Armenian football (soccer) player ==Others== *[[Kevorkian Death Cycle]], an electro-industrial band from Riverside, California, USA *''[[God Bless You, Dr. Kevorkian]]'', a book by Kurt Vonnegut *''Kevorkian'', a 2010 documentary about Dr. Jack Kevorkian *"Dr Kevorkian & the Suicide Machine", the moniker of writer [[Jordan Reyne]] *[[Gevorkian Theological Seminary]], theological school-college of the Armenian Apostolic Church founded by Catholicos Gevork IV in 1874 and located in the city of Vagharshapat (Echmiadzin), Armenia ==See also== *[[Gevorgyan]] {{disambig}}
